page.title: 11POTTON WOOD
page.content: Potton Wood has been designated as an area of SSI (Special Scientific Interest) by the Nature Conservancy Council since it contains a variety of rare forms of plant life and is a remnant of an ancient deciduous woodland. Its most unusual flower is an{Oxlip}(Primula Elatior) but it also has a wide variety of wild orchids including the{Birds Nest}and{ {Twayblade.}A quite remarkable variety of birdlife can be seen in the wood too. The wood is arranged in three sections each distinguished by its tree life. { } 1. Conifers planted for industrial use 2. Coppiced wood 3. Primary Woodland originating from time before man
